poem:
"Cancer Lunette and Royal Blue"

Life parades in trooping colour, bold,
Hope's standard clutched, in hands grown old,
The Princess radiant, behind navy folds,
In the carriage, story of grace unfolds.

Taint of cancer, yet unbowed,
In her courage, we're endowed.
Three saplings of royal root,
Strength inherited, resolute.

Gallant Charles and Camilla fair,
Parading strength, dispelling despair.
In her fight, in her prayer, we share.
